Association: Allele G is not associated with response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele A.
More Details: Presented as trend test of GG, GA, and AA in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with response to donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Response to donepezil was assessed by the mini mental state examination (MMSE) at baseline and at 1, 3, 9 and 15 months after beginning therapy.

Association: Allele T is associated with increased likelihood of cognitive dysfunction when treated with donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele C.
More Details: Alzheimer's Disease (AD) assoc. with decreasing scores of Miniâ€“Mental State Examination (MMSE) and increasing Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR-SB) but overall the main effect on MMSE or CDR-SB was not genotype. Significant interaction between treatment duration and genotype on MMSE decline in the treated group (p < 0.0038) and increased CDR-SB was observed (p < 0.0017) - there was a faster drop in MMSE and increase in CDR-SB scores in the TT genotype when treated with donepezil compared to placebo (p = 0.0096 and p = 0.008 for MMSE and CDR-SB, respectively). After stratifying for APOE4, carriers treated with donepezil, the interaction between treatment duration and genotype on MMSE decline and CDR-SB rise remained significant (p = 0.003 and p < 0.0001 for dMMSE and dCDR-SB, respectively). Similarly, significant interactions persisted between genotype and faster MMSE decline and CDR-SB rise (p = 0.011 and p = 0.0007 for MMSE and CDR-SB, respectively) in treated APOE4 carriers compared to control. There was no significant difference among APOE4 non-carriers.

Association: Allele G is not associated with response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele T.
More Details: Presented as trend test of GG, GT, and TT in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with response to rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Response to rivastimine was assessed by the mini mental state examination (MMSE) at baseline and at 1, 3, 9 and 15 months after beginning therapy.

Association: Allele G is not associated with response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele C.
More Details: Presented as trend test of CC, CG, and GG in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Association: CYP2D6 *1/*1xN + *1xN/*1xN (assigned as ultrarapid metabolizer phenotype) is associated with increased clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.
More Details: Please note; diplotypes were described as *1/*XN, *XN/*XN. Pharmacokinetic model: gender and CYP2D6 metabolizer status explained 11% of the overall variability in donepezil clearance. Model-based simulations were also performed to compared predicted average plasma concentrations with a 10mg once daily dosage regimen suggesting a 41% decrease in average plasma concentrations for ultrarapid metabolizers. Extensive metabolizers were grouped together (diplotypes *1/*3, *1/*4, *1/*5, *1/*6, *1/*1, *4/*1xN, *6/*1xN).

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with response to rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Response to rivastimine was assessed by the mini mental state examination (MMSE) at baseline and at 1, 3, 9 and 15 months after beginning therapy.

Association: Genotype CC is not associated with response to donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CT + TT.
More Details: There were no significant differences between patients carrying at least one copy of rs1803274 C>T (also known as the K-variant) as compared to patients who were homozygous for the C allele in terms of response to donepezil. The primary analysis population was "intent-to-treat with last-observation carried forward" in a group of alzheimer's disease patients under 75 years of age. The cohort included patients on either rivastigmine or donepezil. Multiple tests was used to asses response to either of those drugs: severe impairment battery (SIB), Alzheimer's disease cooperative study activities of daily living (ADCS-ADL) mini-mental state examination (MMSE), the 10-item neuropsychiatric inventory (NPI) and global deterioration scale (GDS).

Association: Allele A is associated with increased response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele G.
More Details: Presented as trend test of CC,TC, and TT (reverse strand) in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Association: Genotypes CT + TT is associated with decreased response to memantine and rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: The primary outcome, response, was assessed by the Alzheimer's Disease assessment scale-cognitive scale (ADAS-cog). Supplementary outcomes were estimated with a series of other tests. "Responders" were patients that had an equal or better score on the outcome measures at 16 weeks as compared to their baseline scores. The study included patients on rivastigmine mono therapy as well as patients with add-on memantine therapy. Some patients carried the APOE4 allele and some did not. Sub-group analysis showed that among patients co-administered memantine the T allele was associated with worse response to rivastigmine.

Association: Genotype GG is not associated with response to rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes AA + AG.
More Details: Response to rivastimine was assessed by the mini mental state examination (MMSE) at baseline and at 1, 3, 9 and 15 months after beginning therapy.

Association: Allele G is not associated with response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele A.
More Details: Presented as trend test of AA,AG, and GG in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Association: Genotype CC is associated with increased response to hmg coa reductase inhibitors in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CT + TT.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, "White and black or African American" subjects
More Details: Analysis of 859 subjects with AD (ROS/MAP dataset) and re-analysis of a clinical trial of simvastatin in 171 AD patients (simvastatin trial) found no significant difference in ADAS-cog scores between statin-treated patients and those treated with placebo. However, analysis of separate genotype subgroups found that E4/E4 subjects in the ROS/MAP dataset had significantly better cognitive function over a 10-year follow-up compared to those treated with placebo. Additionally, there was a non-significant trend in the simvastatin trial for subjects with the E4/E4 genotype who were treated with simvastatin to have lower ADAS-cog scores than E4/E4 patients treated with placebo.

Association: Allele C is not associated with response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele T.
More Details: Presented as trend test of CC, CT, and TT in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Association: Allele C is associated with increased response to donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele T.
More Details: as measured by total ADAS-Cog score obtained at baseline with that obtained at 36 months after MCI diagnosis (diff. ADAS-Cog score) but it was not significantly different. Authors write that "APOE-É›4 and BCHE-K* positive subjects display an earlier age of onset of AD, an accelerated cognitive decline and a greater cognitive benefits to donepezil therapy." ADAS-Cog score difference at 36 months for ApoE4+ =â€“1.92, for those without E4 = â€“0.22.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with response to donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Response to donepezil was assessed by the mini mental state examination (MMSE) at baseline and at 1, 3, 9 and 15 months after beginning therapy.

Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with response to donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Response to donepezil was assessed by the mini mental state examination (MMSE) at baseline and at 1, 3, 9 and 15 months after beginning therapy.

Association: Allele T is associated with increased response to donepezil in women with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele C.
More Details: Cognitive response to treatment was assessed in patients with mild cognitive decline from Alzheimerâ€™s Disease Assessment (ADAS) Score-Cognition by contrasting total ADAS-Cog score obtained at baseline with that obtained at 36 months after MCI diagnosis (diff. ADAS-Cog score). There was a significantly earlier age of onset for female T allele carriers, and APOE4/T co-carriers. Improved response was associated with reduced brain cholinergic activity in carriers.

Association: Genotype TT is associated with increased response to rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Response to rivastimine was assessed by the mini mental state examination (MMSE) at baseline and at 1, 3, 9 and 15 months after beginning therapy.

Association: Genotype AA is associated with decreased severity of Kidney Failure when treated with captopril in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes AT + TT.
More Details: The A allele conferred a protective effect of creatinine increases over 1 year. Association with the effects on creatinine also found in conjunction with the rs1800764CT genotype.

Association: CYP3A7 *1C/*1C is not associated with clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to CYP3A7 *1A/*1A.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.
More Details: Diplotypes *1/*1, *1/*1C, *1C/*1C, did not influence donepezil clearance in a covariate model.

Association: Allele G is associated with increased response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele A.
More Details: Presented as trend test of AA,AG, and GG in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.
More Details: Genotypes of GG, AG and AA did not influence donepezil clearance in a covariate model. Alleles have been complemented to the plus chromosomal strand.

Association: Allele C is not associated with response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele T.
More Details: Presented as trend test of CC, CT, and TT in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Association: Genotype TT is not associated with clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype CC.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.

Association: Allele T is associated with increased response to donepezil, galantamine and rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele C.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, 81.8% European origin, 5.3% African, 12.9% Asian (in Brazil)
More Details: In patients with mild Alzheimer's disease only (baseline Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score >= 20); in patients with moderate to severe Alzheimer's (MMSE <20) no significant results were seen (p=0.73). Adjusted for gender, age, baseline MMSE, and presence of the APOE E4 allele. After 6 months of treatment with cholinesterase inhibitors, those with the T allele were more likely to be a responder to treatment, as compared to those without the T allele. A responder was defined as a patient who showed improvement or no deterioration in cognition comparing MMSE scores at baseline with MMSE scores after 6 months. The authors note in the Discussion section that after 24 months of treatment, no significant association was seen.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype CC.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.
More Details: Genotypes of CYP3A4*1B TT, AC and CC did not influence donepezil clearance in a covariate model. Alleles have been complemented to the plus chromosomal strand.

Association: Genotype CC is associated with increased response to rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotypes CT + TT.
More Details: Patients carrying at least one copy of rs1803274 C>T (also known as the K-variant) demonstrated less response to rivastigmine than patients who were homozygous for the C allele. The primary analysis population was "intent-to-treat with last-observation carried forward" in a group of alzheimer's disease patients under 75 years of age. The cohort included patients on either rivastigmine or donepezil. Multiple tests was used to asses response to either of those drugs: severe impairment battery (SIB), Alzheimer's disease cooperative study activities of daily living (ADCS-ADL) mini-mental state examination (MMSE), the 10-item neuropsychiatric inventory (NPI) and global deterioration scale (GDS).

No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.

Association: CYP2D6 *4/*4 + *4/*5 (assigned as poor metabolizer phenotype) is associated with decreased clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.
More Details: Pharmacokinetic model: gender and CYP2D6 metabolizer status explained 11% of the overall variability in donepezil clearance. Model-based simulations were also performed to compared predicted average plasma concentrations with a 10mg once daily dosage regimen suggesting a 43% increase in average plasma concentrations for poor metabolizers. Extensive metabolizers were grouped together (diplotypes *1/*3, *1/*4, *1/*5, *1/*6, *1/*1, *4/*1xN, *6/*1xN).

Association: Allele A is not associated with likelihood of Alzheimer Disease.
Allele T is associated with increased response to donepezil, galantamine and rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele C.
More Details: The study contained a discovery sample and a replication sample, and also did a meta-analysis of the two samples together. Response is defined as patients whose mini-mental state examination (MMSE) points increased, remained stable, or the change in MMSE points between baseline and end of follow-up (deltaMMSE) fell by 1 point or less. Non-responders were defined as worsening of >3 points on the MMSE. Patients had been treated with cholinesterase inhibitors for at least 6 months. The study also assessed the influence of the SNP on deltaMMSE. Please note alleles have been complemented to the plus chromosomal strand, and that this SNP did NOT reach genome-wide significance in any of the samples.

Association: Genotype AA is not associated with clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype GG.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.
More Details: Genotypes of AA, AG and GG did not influence donepezil clearance in a covariate model. Alleles have been complemented to the plus chromosomal strand.

Association: CYP2D6 *4/*4 + *4/*5 (assigned as poor metabolizer phenotype) is associated with increased likelihood of adverse events when treated with donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, One arabian patient, all others were Caucasian.
More Details: 70% of poor metabolizers compared to 40% of the rest of the cohort had one or more adverse events. This was not statistically significant.

Association: Allele A is associated with increased risk of treatment-resistance when treated with olanzapine and risperidone in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele G.
Genotype GG is not associated with clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype AA.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.
More Details: Genotypes of GG, AG and AA did not influence donepezil clearance in a covariate model. Alleles have been complemented to the plus chromosomal strand.

Association: CYP2D6 poor metabolizer is associated with decreased metabolism of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to CYP2D6 normal metabolizer.
More Details: The authors performed CYP2D6 phenotyping with dextromethorphan to determine individual patient's CYP2D6 activity. The ratio of donepezil: donepezil metabolites was significantly associated with CYP2D6 phenotype, but not with patient outcome as assayed by mini mental evaluations.

Response is defined as patients whose mini-mental state examination (MMSE) points increased, remained stable, or the delta MMSE fell by 1 or less. Non-responders were defined as worsening of >3 points on the MMSE. Please note alleles have been complemented to the plus chromosomal strand, and that this SNP did NOT reach genome-wide significance in any of the samples.

Association: Genotypes CC + CT is associated with decreased response to donepezil, galantamine and rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype TT.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, 81.8% European origin, 5.3% African, 12.9% Asian (in Brazil)
More Details: In patients with moderate to severe Alzheimer's disease only (baseline Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score < 20); in patients with mild Alzheimer's (MMSE >=20) no significant/borderline significant results were seen (p=0.05). Adjusted for gender, age, and baseline MMSE. After 6 months of treatment with cholinesterase inhibitors, those with the E4 allele were more likely to be a non-responder to treatment, as compared to those without the E4 allele. A responder was defined as a patient who showed improvement or no deterioration in cognition comparing MMSE scores at baseline with MMSE scores after 6 months.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype CC.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.

Association: Allele C is not associated with response to donepezil, galantamine or rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to allele T.
More Details: Presented as trend test of CC, CT, and TT in responder vs non responder. Donepezil 84 patients, galantamine 52 patients, rivastigmine 22 patients. No significant differences in genotype by drug type. Patients assessed after 1 week and 4 weeks of therapy to adjust dosage and evaluate adverse events. Response rate assessed at 26 weeks of treatment.

Association: Genotype CC is not associated with clearance of donepezil in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype TT.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, n=1 Arabian patient, the rest were Caucasian.

Association: Genotypes CT + TT is associated with decreased response to rivastigmine in people with Alzheimer Disease as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: The primary outcome, response, was assessed by the Alzheimer's Disease assessment scale-cognitive scale (ADAS-cog). Supplementary outcomes were estimated with a series of other tests. "Responders" were patients that had an equal or better score on the outcome measures at 16 weeks as compared to their baseline scores. The study included patients on rivastigmine mono therapy as well as patients with add-on memantine therapy. Some patients carried the APOE4 allele and some did not. Sub-group analysis showed that among carriers of the APOE4 allele and among AD patients with a high mini-mental state exam score (greater or equal to 16) the T allele was associated with worse response to rivastigmine.
